items.title: Leveraging tax credits and incentives for sustainability projects

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Randa Barsoum, Tax Partner at PwC US, emphasizes that energy tax credits are only part of the sustainability incentives picture. She highlights less obvious opportunities‚Äîstate and local abatements, location-based incentives, and R&D tax credits tied to innovation‚Äîthat can unlock meaningful tax value when sustainability investments are viewed more broadly.
bullets: Energy incentives are commonly top of mind but not the only opportunities.
State and local abatements can support sustainability projects.
Location-based incentives matter for siting and investment decisions.
R&D tax credits can apply to innovation efforts (e.g., reimagining packaging or processes).
PwC recommends viewing sustainability investments through a broader tax-incentive lens (see PwC resource link in description).
takeaways: Include state and local abatements in site-selection and cost models for grid/data center projects.
Evaluate location-based incentives as part of total project economics, not just operational factors.
Investigate R&D tax credits for innovation in processes or technologies tied to operations and efficiency.
Build broader tax-incentive analysis into sustainability ROI assessments and capital planning.
Engage tax specialists early to identify non-energy incentives that could affect project viability.

items.title: Bringing In $251K A Year With 3 Jobs In The Bay Area

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Naseema McElroy, a 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse in Brentwood, California, runs a personal finance brand and brings in $251K a year across three jobs in the Bay Area. She accumulated nearly $1 million in debt in 2015, started Financially Intentional to document her debt-payoff journey, and was debt-free by 2017.
bullets: 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse based in Brentwood, CA
Earns $251K annually from three jobs in the Bay Area
Nearly $1M in debt in 2015; pursued financial education and management
Started the personal finance brand 'Financially Intentional' to document her journey
Was debt-free by 2017; featured in CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series
takeaways: Presence of high-earning, multi-job professionals in the Bay Area may signal sustained local demand for reliable power and digital infrastructure.
Growth of personal finance brands and content creators suggests continued need for broadband capacity and hosting services.
Healthcare professionals as content creators combine steady employment income with digital service usage patterns that planners should consider.
Profiles highlighting remote/online business activity underscore importance of planning for both residential and small-business digital consumption.

items.title: GeForce Garage - Summer of RTX Community Build

ai.summary: Based on the available description‚Ä¶ NVIDIA's GeForce Garage showcases the winner of the Summer of RTX r/buildapc Community Build (u/JeffersonPutnam), a small-form-factor system featuring a GeForce RTX 5090 Founders Edition. The build uses a Fractal Design Era 2 chassis with a Ryzen 7 9800X3D, 32GB DDR5-6000, Corsair SF1000 power supply, and a Corsair Nautilus 240 RS AIO; a PCPartPicker parts list is linked.
bullets: Community build winner: u/JeffersonPutnam (Summer of RTX r/buildapc contest).
Chassis: Fractal Design Era 2; GPU: GeForce RTX 5090 Founders Edition.
Core components: MSI MPG B850I Edge motherboard, Ryzen 7 9800X3D CPU, 32GB Teamgroup DDR5-6000 RAM.
Power and cooling: Corsair SF1000 PSU and Corsair Nautilus 240 RS AIO.
PCPartPicker parts list and NVIDIA social links provided in the description.
takeaways: High-end desktop GPUs (GeForce RTX 5090) were fitted into a small-form-factor chassis, indicating feasibility of dense desktop workstation deployments where space is constrained.
A 1000W SFX power supply (Corsair SF1000) was chosen‚Äîverify power delivery and PSU form factor compatibility when planning compact high-power systems.
An AIO liquid cooler (Corsair Nautilus 240 RS) was used for thermal management in the confined case‚Äîexpect cooling to be a key consideration for sustained workloads.
A full parts list is available via PCPartPicker for evaluation and procurement planning.

items.title: TTEC accelerates AI deployment and revenue streams with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description, TTEC partnered with Google Cloud Consulting to rapidly prototype and deploy AI solutions that unlocked new revenue streams. They leveraged GenAI and Google Cloud's robust infrastructure to streamline operations, boost developer productivity, and compress their digital transformation timeline.
bullets: TTEC worked with Google Cloud Consulting to quickly prototype and deploy AI solutions.
GenAI and Google Cloud infrastructure were used to streamline operations.
Developer productivity increased through the deployed AI tools and platforms.
The partnership compressed TTEC's digital transformation timeline.
New revenue streams and expanded business ambitions resulted from the work.
takeaways: Engaging cloud consulting can shorten AI prototyping-to-production timelines, reducing time-to-value.
Robust cloud infrastructure supports faster developer productivity and operational streamlining.
Faster AI deployment can create new revenue opportunities without waiting for long internal build cycles.
Partnerships with experienced cloud teams can expand what‚Äôs feasible for business transformation.
